Ammonium chloride is an inorganic compound with the formula NH4Cl and a white crystalline salt that is highly soluble in water. Solutions of ammonium chloride are mildly acidic. Sal ammoniac is a name of the natural, mineralogical form of ammonium chloride. The mineral is commonly formed on burning coal dumps from condensation of coal-derived gases. It is also found around some types of volcanic vents. It is mainly used as fertilizer and a flavouring agent in some types of liquorice. It is the product from the reaction of hydrochloric acid and ammonia.

My woodburning technique consists of a magnifying glass and the sun. I print a black & white image, preferably a line-art image, and stick it to some wood with wallpaperglue or any water based glue. I then use the magnifying glass to make a first imprint. The black ink soaks up heat from the sun a lot better than the white from the paper so the process easily forgives minor mistakes. It does take practise, though. I have a very steady hand now. After burning I scrub off the paper with water and a scrubbingsponge, and then I can go for a second burning if I feel it needs to have some more depth.
Awesome method. Highly recommend you try this in the summer.
